intro: Licania triandra, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in coastal areas and brackish water environments. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and specialized root systems that help it thrive in saline conditions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Licania triandra plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
